content:
On average, the cost of living in Hulme is relatively lower than other parts of Manchester. This is due in part to the fact that Hulme has historically been an area with lower property prices and rents compared to other areas of the city. However, like any area, the cost of living in Hulme can vary depending on factors such as the type of housing, amenities, and lifestyle choices.

According to Numbeo, a database that compares the cost of living in cities around the world, the cost of living in Hulme is approximately 18% lower than in the city center of Manchester. This means that residents of Hulme can save money on a range of expenses, including housing, groceries, and eating out.

However, it's worth noting that as the area continues to develop and improve, the cost of living in Hulme may increase, and the market value of properties may change. Nonetheless, Hulme is still an affordable area to live in compared to other parts of Manchester, making it an attractive destination for many.
